Version

This is version 2 of the file.

Purpose

OF Filesystem access, common header file.  The Filesystem module has implementation files for Windows and POSIX.

Author

Daniel “q66” Kolesa quak.nosp@m.er66@gmai.nosp@m.l.com

License

This file is licensed under MIT.  See COPYING.txt for more information.

namespace filesystem

Enumerations

File_Type

This enumeration represents the file types defined by the module.

Types

OFTL_FILE_UNKNOWNunknown file type.
OFTL_FILE_FIFOnamed pipe (FIFO) type (POSIX only).
OFTL_FILE_CHRcharacter device type (POSIX only).
OFTL_FILE_DIRdirectory type.
OFTL_FILE_BLKblock device type (POSIX only).
OFTL_FILE_REGregular file type.
OFTL_FILE_LNKsymbolic link type.
OFTL_FILE_SOCKUNIX domain socket type (POSIX only).
OFTL_FILE_WHTwhiteout file type (POSIX only).

Types

File_Vector

Defined as types:: Vector < File_Info >.  Returned by list.

Functions

separator

const char separator()

Returns a path separator character for the platform (as simple char).  On POSIX, it’s /, on Windows, it’s \.

list

inline File_Vector list(const File_Info &path)

Returns a File_Vector containing complete contents of the directory given by the argument.

Basically performs

File_Vector ret;
for (File_Iterator it = path.begin(); it != path.end(); ++it)
    ret.push_back(*it);
return ret;

As this has to make a vector and push everything, it’s less efficient than just iterating over a directory, so do this only when really required.

normalize_path

void normalize_path(types::String &str)

Normalizes a path string given by the argument.  As the argument is a reference, it simply writes into the passed string.  It has no return value.

join_path

template<typename... T> inline File_Info join_path(const T&... args)

Joins a set of strings (<String>, const char*, char) into a path and returns a File_Info of the path.  Example:

 // f will be foo/bar/baz/bah.txt on POSIX
 // and foo\bar\baz\bah.txt on Windows.
File_Info f = filesystem::join_path(
    "foo", "bar", "baz", "bah.txt"
);

File_Info

struct File_Info

This structure represents a state of a file or directory.  Directories define iterators.  All types are parseable into whole path, stem (filename minus extension), filename and extension.

You can get their type (see filesystem.File_Type), last access time (atime), last modification time (mtime) and creation time (ctime).

Functions

File_Info

File_Info(
   
): p_slash(types::String::npos), p_dot(types::String::npos), p_type(OFTL_FILE_UNKNOWN), p_path(types::String()), p_atime(0), p_mtime(0), p_ctime(0)

Empty constructor.  Initializes the type as unknown, path as empty string and times to 0.

File_Info

File_Info(
   const File_Info &info
): p_slash(info.p_slash), p_dot (info.p_dot ), p_type (info.p_type ), p_path (info.p_path ), p_atime(info.p_atime), p_mtime(info.p_mtime), p_ctime(info.p_ctime)

Constructs a File_Info from another instance of one.  Basically a copy.

File_Info

File_Info(const char *path)

Constructs a File_Info from a path string (const char*).

File_Info

File_Info(const types::String &path)

Same as above, but the string type is String_Base <char>.

begin

File_Iterator begin() const

Directory specific.  If called for a file, returns an empty File_Iterator.  Otherwise, returns an iterator to the first file / directory in the directory.

end

File_Iterator end() const

Returns an empty File_Iterator.  Used for comparison, as incrementing an iterator to the last item in a directory results in empty iterator.

path

types::String path() const

Returns the whole path (i.e. foo/bar/baz.txt).

stem

types::String stem() const

Returns a “stem”, that is a filename without an extension (i.e. when the path is foo/bar/baz.txt, this returns just baz).

filename

types::String filename() const

Returns a filename (i.e. for path foo/bar/baz.txt, this returns baz.txt).

extension

types::String extension() const

Returns the extension part of the filename (i.e. for path foo/bar/baz.txt, this returns .txt including the dot).

type

File_Type type() const

Returns the filesystem.File_Type of the file or directory assigned to this instance.

normalize

void normalize()

Normalizes the path, that is, gets rid of redundant . and .., on POSIX it converts backslashes to forward slashes and on Windows it does the opposite.

atime

time_t atime() const

Returns the file / directory last access time as time_t.

atime

Returns the file / directory last modification time as time_t.

atime

Returns the file / directory creation time as time_t.

File_Iterator

struct File_Iterator

A “file iterator”.  Used to iterate directory contents.  An instance of this will is returned by the “begin” and “end” methods of File_Info.

Example that prints names of all files in the current working directory:

File_Info cwd(".");
for (File_Iterator it = cwd.begin(); it != cwd.end(); ++it)
    printf("%s\n", it->filename().get_buf());

This is also used by the list function, which inserts all the data from the iteration into a vector.

This is a forward iterator type with all properties that are specific to it.  Difference type is ptrdiff_t, value type is File_Info, reference type is const File_Info &, pointer type is const File_Info*.

A slight difference from other iterators is that both prefix and postfix versions of the ++ operator have the exact same effect.

Types

diff_t

val_t

Functions

File_Iterator

File_Iterator()

Constructs an empty file iterator, used as an ending iterator.

File_Iterator

File_Iterator(const types::String &path)

Constructs an iterator from a path given by the argument.  The path specifies the directory to iterate.

If it’s a file or invalid path, it has the same effect as creating an empty iterator.

File_Iterator

File_Iterator(const File_Iterator &it)

Constructs an iterator from another one.

File_Iterator

~File_Iterator()

Destroys the iterator.

*

ref_t operator*() const

Dereferencing the iterator returns a ref_t.

->

ptr_t operator->() const

Pointer-like iterator access.

++

File_Iterator& operator++()

Moves to the next item in the directory.  Prefix version.

++

File_Iterator& operator++(int)

See above.  Postfix version, but it has the same effect.

!=

bool operator!=(const File_Iterator &b)

template<typename T> struct Vector
Vector is a container that holds a list of elements simillarily to an array, but it’s generic, can be easily manipulated (resized, appended etc.)
